     556       10030 :     double e = bbox->eastBoundLongitude();
     557       10030 :     double n = bbox->northBoundLatitude();

     559         718 :         e += 360.0;
     560             :     }

     562       30090 :     return (e - w) * (std::sin(common::Angle(n).getSIValue()) -
     563       20060 :                       std::sin(common::Angle(s).getSIValue()));

    1591             :             }

    2025             : /** \brief Validate the parameters used by a coordinate operation.

    2332             :

    2813             : 
    2814             : /** \brief Instantiate a [Universal Transverse Mercator]
    2815             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/utm.html) conversion.
    2816             :  *
    2817             :  * UTM is a family of conversions, of EPSG codes from 16001 to 16060 for the
    2818             :  * northern hemisphere, and 17001 to 17060 for the southern hemisphere,
    2819             :  * based on the Transverse Mercator projection method.
    2820             :  *
    2821             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    2822             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    2823             :  * @param zone UTM zone number between 1 and 60.
    2824             :  * @param north true for UTM northern hemisphere, false for UTM southern
    2825             :  * hemisphere.
    2826             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    2827             :  */
    2828         132 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createUTM(const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    2829             :                                       int zone, bool north) {
    2830             :     return create(
    2831         264 :         getUTMConversionProperty(properties, zone, north),
    2832             :         EPSG_CODE_METHOD_TRANSVERSE_MERCATOR,
    2833         264 :         createParams(common::Angle(UTM_LATITUDE_OF_NATURAL_ORIGIN),
    2834         264 :                      common::Angle(zone * 6.0 - 183.0),
    2835         264 :                      common::Scale(UTM_SCALE_FACTOR),
    2836         264 :                      common::Length(UTM_FALSE_EASTING),
    2837         264 :                      common::Length(north ? UTM_NORTH_FALSE_NORTHING
    2838         132 :                                           : UTM_SOUTH_FALSE_NORTHING)));
    2839             : }
    2840             : 
    2841             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    2842             : 
    2843             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Transverse Mercator]
    2844             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/tmerc.html) projection method.
    2845             :  *
    2846             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9807]
    2847             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9807)
    2848             :  *
    2849             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    2850             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    2851             :  * @param centerLat See \ref center_latitude
    2852             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    2853             :  * @param scale See \ref scale
    2854             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting

    3044             : 
    3045             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Lambert Conic Conformal (2SP)]
    3046             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/lcc.html) projection method.
    3047             :  *
    3048             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9802]
    3049             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9802)
    3050             :  *
    3051             :  * @note the order of arguments is conformant with the corresponding EPSG
    3052             :  * mode and different than OGRSpatialReference::setLCC() of GDAL &lt;= 2.3
    3053             :  *
    3054             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3055             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3056             :  * @param latitudeFalseOrigin See \ref latitude_false_origin
    3057             :  * @param longitudeFalseOrigin See \ref longitude_false_origin
    3058             :  * @param latitudeFirstParallel See \ref latitude_first_std_parallel
    3059             :  * @param latitudeSecondParallel See \ref latitude_second_std_parallel
    3060             :  * @param eastingFalseOrigin See \ref easting_false_origin
    3061             :  * @param northingFalseOrigin See \ref northing_false_origin
    3062             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3063             :  */
    3064          17 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createLambertConicConformal_2SP(
    3065             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3066             :     const common::Angle &latitudeFalseOrigin,
    3067             :     const common::Angle &longitudeFalseOrigin,
    3068             :     const common::Angle &latitudeFirstParallel,
    3069             :     const common::Angle &latitudeSecondParallel,
    3070             :     const common::Length &eastingFalseOrigin,
    3071             :     const common::Length &northingFalseOrigin) {
    3072             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_2SP,
    3073          34 :                   createParams(latitudeFalseOrigin, longitudeFalseOrigin,
    3074             :                                latitudeFirstParallel, latitudeSecondParallel,
    3075          17 :                                eastingFalseOrigin, northingFalseOrigin));

    3117             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Lambert Conic Conformal (2SP
    3118             :  *Belgium)]

    3122             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9803)

    3125             :  * the regular LCC_2SP method.
    3126             :  *

    3128             :  * mode and different than OGRSpatialReference::setLCCB() of GDAL &lt;= 2.3
    3129             :  *

    3131             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.

    3133             :  * @param longitudeFalseOrigin See \ref longitude_false_origin

    3135             :  * @param latitudeSecondParallel See \ref latitude_second_std_parallel
    3136             :  * @param eastingFalseOrigin See \ref easting_false_origin
    3137             :  * @param northingFalseOrigin See \ref northing_false_origin
    3138             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3139             :  */

    3245             :  * a non-spherical ellipsoid is used for the base GeographicCRS.

    3475           4 :                   createParams(centerLong, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3476             : }
    3477             : 
    3478             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3479             : 
    3480             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Equidistant Cylindrical]
    3481             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/eqc.html) projection method.
    3482             :  *
    3483             :  * This is also known as the Equirectangular method, and in the particular case
    3484             :  * where the latitude of first parallel is 0.
    3485             :  *
    3486             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:1028]
    3487             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::1028)
    3488             :  *
    3489             :  * @note This is the equivalent OGRSpatialReference::SetEquirectangular2(
    3490             :  * 0.0, latitudeFirstParallel, falseEasting, falseNorthing ) of GDAL &lt;= 2.3,
    3491             :  * where the lat_0 / center_latitude parameter is forced to 0.
    3492             :  *
    3493             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3494             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3495             :  * @param latitudeFirstParallel See \ref latitude_first_std_parallel.
    3496             :  * @param longitudeNatOrigin See \ref center_longitude
    3497             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3498             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3499             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3500             :  */
    3501           3 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createEquidistantCylindrical(
    3502             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3503             :     const common::Angle &latitudeFirstParallel,
    3504             :     const common::Angle &longitudeNatOrigin, const common::Length &falseEasting,
    3505             :     const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3506             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_EQUIDISTANT_CYLINDRICAL,
    3507          18 :                   createParams(latitudeFirstParallel, 0.0, longitudeNatOrigin,
    3508           3 :                                falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3509             : }
    3510             : 
    3511             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3512             : 
    3513             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Equidistant Cylindrical
    3514             :  *(Spherical)]
    3515             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/eqc.html) projection method.
    3516             :  *
    3517             :  * This is also known as the Equirectangular method, and in the particular case
    3518             :  * where the latitude of first parallel is 0.
    3519             :  *
    3520             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:1029]
    3521             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::1029)
    3522             :  *
    3523             :  * @note This is the equivalent OGRSpatialReference::SetEquirectangular2(
    3524             :  * 0.0, latitudeFirstParallel, falseEasting, falseNorthing ) of GDAL &lt;= 2.3,
    3525             :  * where the lat_0 / center_latitude parameter is forced to 0.
    3526             :  *
    3527             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3528             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3529             :  * @param latitudeFirstParallel See \ref latitude_first_std_parallel.
    3530             :  * @param longitudeNatOrigin See \ref center_longitude
    3531             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3532             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3533             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3534             :  */
    3535           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createEquidistantCylindricalSpherical(
    3536             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3537             :     const common::Angle &latitudeFirstParallel,
    3538             :     const common::Angle &longitudeNatOrigin, const common::Length &falseEasting,
    3539             :     const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3540             :     return create(properties,
    3541             :                   EPSG_CODE_METHOD_EQUIDISTANT_CYLINDRICAL_SPHERICAL,
    3542          12 :                   createParams(latitudeFirstParallel, 0.0, longitudeNatOrigin,
    3543           2 :                                falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3544             : }
    3545             : 
    3546             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3547             : 
    3548             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Gall (Stereographic)]
    3549             :  * (https://proj.org/operations/projections/gall.html) projection method.
    3550             :  *
    3551             :  * There is no equivalent in EPSG.
    3552             :  *
    3553             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3554             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3555             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    3556             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3557             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3558             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3559             :  */
    3560           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createGall(const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3561             :                                        const common::Angle &centerLong,
    3562             :                                        const common::Length &falseEasting,
    3563             :                                        const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3564             :     return create(properties, PROJ_WKT2_NAME_METHOD_GALL_STEREOGRAPHIC,
    3565           4 :                   createParams(centerLong, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3566             : }
    3567             : 
    3568             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3569             : 
    3570             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Goode Homolosine]

    3582           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createGoodeHomolosine(
    3583             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &centerLong,
    3584             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3585             :     return create(properties, PROJ_WKT2_NAME_METHOD_GOODE_HOMOLOSINE,
    3586           4 :                   createParams(centerLong, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3587             : }
    3588             : 
    3589             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3590             : 
    3591             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Interrupted Goode Homolosine]
    3592             :  * (https://proj.org/operations/projections/igh.html) projection method.
    3593             :  *
    3594             :  * There is no equivalent in EPSG.
    3595             :  *
    3596             :  * @note OGRSpatialReference::SetIGH() of GDAL &lt;= 2.3 assumes the 3
    3597             :  * projection
    3598             :  * parameters to be zero and this is the nominal case.
    3599             :  *
    3600             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3601             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3602             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    3603             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3604             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3605             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3606             :  */

    3608             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &centerLong,
    3609             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {

    3611             :                   PROJ_WKT2_NAME_METHOD_INTERRUPTED_GOODE_HOMOLOSINE,
    3612           4 :                   createParams(centerLong, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3613             : }
    3614             : 
    3615             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3616             : 
    3617             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Geostationary Satellite View]
    3618             :  * (https://proj.org/operations/projections/geos.html) projection method,
    3619             :  * with the sweep angle axis of the viewing instrument being x
    3620             :  *
    3621             :  * There is no equivalent in EPSG.
    3622             :  *

    3624             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3625             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    3626             :  * @param height Height of the view point above the Earth.
    3627             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3628             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3629             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3630             :  */

    3637           4 :         createParams(centerLong, height, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3638             : }
    3639             : 
    3640             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3641             : 
    3642             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Geostationary Satellite View]
    3643             :  * (https://proj.org/operations/projections/geos.html) projection method,

    3671             :  *

    3673             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.

    3676             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting

    3681             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &centerLat,

    3683             :     const common::Length &falseNorthing) {

    3686           4 :         createParams(centerLat, centerLong, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3687             : }
    3688             : 
    3689             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3690             : 
    3691             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Hotine Oblique Mercator
    3692             :  *(Variant A)]
    3693             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/omerc.html) projection method
    3694             :  *
    3695             :  * This is the variant with the no_uoff parameter, which corresponds to
    3696             :  * GDAL &gt;=2.3 Hotine_Oblique_Mercator projection.
    3697             :  * In this variant, the false grid coordinates are
    3698             :  * defined at the intersection of the initial line and the aposphere (the
    3699             :  * equator on one of the intermediate surfaces inherent in the method), that is
    3700             :  * at the natural origin of the coordinate system).
    3701             :  *
    3702             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9812]
    3703             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9812)
    3704             :  *
    3705             :  * \note In the case where azimuthInitialLine = angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid =
    3706             :  *90deg,
    3707             :  * this maps to the  [Swiss Oblique Mercator]
    3708             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/somerc.html) formulas.
    3709             :  *
    3710             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3711             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3712             :  * @param latitudeProjectionCentre See \ref latitude_projection_centre
    3713             :  * @param longitudeProjectionCentre See \ref longitude_projection_centre
    3714             :  * @param azimuthInitialLine See \ref azimuth_initial_line
    3715             :  * @param angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid See
    3716             :  * \ref angle_from_recitfied_to_skrew_grid
    3717             :  * @param scale See \ref scale_factor_initial_line
    3718             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3719             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3720             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3721             :  */
    3722           5 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createHotineObliqueMercatorVariantA(
    3723             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3724             :     const common::Angle &latitudeProjectionCentre,
    3725             :     const common::Angle &longitudeProjectionCentre,
    3726             :     const common::Angle &azimuthInitialLine,
    3727             :     const common::Angle &angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid,
    3728             :     const common::Scale &scale, const common::Length &falseEasting,
    3729             :     const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3730             :     return create(
    3731             :         properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_HOTINE_OBLIQUE_MERCATOR_VARIANT_A,
    3732          10 :         createParams(latitudeProjectionCentre, longitudeProjectionCentre,
    3733             :                      azimuthInitialLine, angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid, scale,
    3734           5 :                      falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3735             : }
    3736             : 
    3737             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3738             : 
    3739             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Hotine Oblique Mercator
    3740             :  *(Variant B)]
    3741             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/omerc.html) projection method
    3742             :  *
    3743             :  * This is the variant without the no_uoff parameter, which corresponds to
    3744             :  * GDAL &gt;=2.3 Hotine_Oblique_Mercator_Azimuth_Center projection.
    3745             :  * In this variant, the false grid coordinates are defined at the projection
    3746             :  *centre.
    3747             :  *
    3748             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9815]
    3749             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9815)
    3750             :  *
    3751             :  * \note In the case where azimuthInitialLine = angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid =
    3752             :  *90deg,
    3753             :  * this maps to the  [Swiss Oblique Mercator]
    3754             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/somerc.html) formulas.
    3755             :  *
    3756             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3757             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3758             :  * @param latitudeProjectionCentre See \ref latitude_projection_centre
    3759             :  * @param longitudeProjectionCentre See \ref longitude_projection_centre
    3760             :  * @param azimuthInitialLine See \ref azimuth_initial_line
    3761             :  * @param angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid See
    3762             :  * \ref angle_from_recitfied_to_skrew_grid
    3763             :  * @param scale See \ref scale_factor_initial_line
    3764             :  * @param eastingProjectionCentre See \ref easting_projection_centre
    3765             :  * @param northingProjectionCentre See \ref northing_projection_centre
    3766             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3767             :  */
    3768           3 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createHotineObliqueMercatorVariantB(
    3769             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3770             :     const common::Angle &latitudeProjectionCentre,
    3771             :     const common::Angle &longitudeProjectionCentre,
    3772             :     const common::Angle &azimuthInitialLine,
    3773             :     const common::Angle &angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid,
    3774             :     const common::Scale &scale, const common::Length &eastingProjectionCentre,
    3775             :     const common::Length &northingProjectionCentre) {
    3776             :     return create(
    3777             :         properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_HOTINE_OBLIQUE_MERCATOR_VARIANT_B,
    3778           6 :         createParams(latitudeProjectionCentre, longitudeProjectionCentre,
    3779             :                      azimuthInitialLine, angleFromRectifiedToSkrewGrid, scale,
    3780           3 :                      eastingProjectionCentre, northingProjectionCentre));
    3781             : }
    3782             : 
    3783             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3784             : 
    3785             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Hotine Oblique Mercator Two
    3786             :  *Point Natural Origin]
    3787             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/omerc.html) projection method.
    3788             :  *
    3789             :  * There is no equivalent in EPSG.
    3790             :  *
    3791             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3792             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3793             :  * @param latitudeProjectionCentre See \ref latitude_projection_centre
    3794             :  * @param latitudePoint1 Latitude of point 1.
    3795             :  * @param longitudePoint1 Latitude of point 1.
    3796             :  * @param latitudePoint2 Latitude of point 2.
    3797             :  * @param longitudePoint2 Longitude of point 2.
    3798             :  * @param scale See \ref scale_factor_initial_line
    3799             :  * @param eastingProjectionCentre See \ref easting_projection_centre
    3800             :  * @param northingProjectionCentre See \ref northing_projection_centre
    3801             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3802             :  */
    3803           3 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createHotineObliqueMercatorTwoPointNaturalOrigin(
    3804             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3805             :     const common::Angle &latitudeProjectionCentre,
    3806             :     const common::Angle &latitudePoint1, const common::Angle &longitudePoint1,
    3807             :     const common::Angle &latitudePoint2, const common::Angle &longitudePoint2,
    3808             :     const common::Scale &scale, const common::Length &eastingProjectionCentre,
    3809             :     const common::Length &northingProjectionCentre) {
    3810             :     return create(
    3811             :         properties,
    3812             :         PROJ_WKT2_NAME_METHOD_HOTINE_OBLIQUE_MERCATOR_TWO_POINT_NATURAL_ORIGIN,
    3813             :         {
    3814             :             ParameterValue::create(latitudeProjectionCentre),
    3815             :             ParameterValue::create(latitudePoint1),
    3816             :             ParameterValue::create(longitudePoint1),
    3817             :             ParameterValue::create(latitudePoint2),
    3818             :             ParameterValue::create(longitudePoint2),
    3819             :             ParameterValue::create(scale),
    3820             :             ParameterValue::create(eastingProjectionCentre),
    3821             :             ParameterValue::create(northingProjectionCentre),
    3822           6 :         });
    3823             : }
    3824             : 
    3825             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3826             : 
    3827             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Laborde Oblique Mercator]
    3828             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/labrd.html) projection method.
    3829             :  *
    3830             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9813]
    3831             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9813)
    3832             :  *
    3833             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3834             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3835             :  * @param latitudeProjectionCentre See \ref latitude_projection_centre
    3836             :  * @param longitudeProjectionCentre See \ref longitude_projection_centre
    3837             :  * @param azimuthInitialLine See \ref azimuth_initial_line
    3838             :  * @param scale See \ref scale_factor_initial_line
    3839             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3840             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3841             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3842             :  */
    3843           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createLabordeObliqueMercator(
    3844             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3845             :     const common::Angle &latitudeProjectionCentre,
    3846             :     const common::Angle &longitudeProjectionCentre,
    3847             :     const common::Angle &azimuthInitialLine, const common::Scale &scale,
    3848             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3849             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LABORDE_OBLIQUE_MERCATOR,
    3850           4 :                   createParams(latitudeProjectionCentre,

    3852           2 :                                scale, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    3853             : }
    3854             : 
    3855             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3856             : 
    3857             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [International Map of the World
    3858             :  *Polyconic]
    3859             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/imw_p.html) projection method.
    3860             :  *
    3861             :  * There is no equivalent in EPSG.
    3862             :  *
    3863             :  * @note the order of arguments is conformant with the corresponding EPSG
    3864             :  * mode and different than OGRSpatialReference::SetIWMPolyconic() of GDAL &lt;=
    3865             :  *2.3
    3866             :  *
    3867             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3868             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3869             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    3870             :  * @param latitudeFirstParallel See \ref latitude_first_std_parallel
    3871             :  * @param latitudeSecondParallel See \ref latitude_second_std_parallel
    3872             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3873             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3874             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3875             :  */
    3876           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createInternationalMapWorldPolyconic(
    3877             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &centerLong,
    3878             :     const common::Angle &latitudeFirstParallel,
    3879             :     const common::Angle &latitudeSecondParallel,
    3880             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3881             :     return create(properties, PROJ_WKT2_NAME_INTERNATIONAL_MAP_WORLD_POLYCONIC,
    3882           4 :                   createParams(centerLong, latitudeFirstParallel,
    3883             :                                latitudeSecondParallel, falseEasting,
    3884           4 :                                falseNorthing));
    3885             : }
    3886             : 
    3887             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3888             : 
    3889             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Krovak (north oriented)]
    3890             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/krovak.html) projection method.
    3891             :  *
    3892             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:1041]
    3893             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::1041)
    3894             :  *
    3895             :  * The coordinates are returned in the "GIS friendly" order: easting, northing.
    3896             :  * This method is similar to createKrovak(), except that the later returns
    3897             :  * projected values as southing, westing, where
    3898             :  * southing(Krovak) = -northing(Krovak_North) and
    3899             :  * westing(Krovak) = -easting(Krovak_North).
    3900             :  *
    3901             :  * @note The current PROJ implementation of Krovak hard-codes
    3902             :  * colatitudeConeAxis = 30deg17'17.30311"
    3903             :  * and latitudePseudoStandardParallel = 78deg30'N, which are the values used for
    3904             :  * the ProjectedCRS S-JTSK (Ferro) / Krovak East North (EPSG:5221).
    3905             :  * It also hard-codes the parameters of the Bessel ellipsoid typically used for
    3906             :  * Krovak.
    3907             :  *
    3908             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3909             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3910             :  * @param latitudeProjectionCentre See \ref latitude_projection_centre
    3911             :  * @param longitudeOfOrigin See \ref longitude_of_origin
    3912             :  * @param colatitudeConeAxis See \ref colatitude_cone_axis
    3913             :  * @param latitudePseudoStandardParallel See \ref
    3914             :  *latitude_pseudo_standard_parallel
    3915             :  * @param scaleFactorPseudoStandardParallel See \ref
    3916             :  *scale_factor_pseudo_standard_parallel
    3917             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3918             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3919             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3920             :  */
    3921           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createKrovakNorthOriented(
    3922             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3923             :     const common::Angle &latitudeProjectionCentre,
    3924             :     const common::Angle &longitudeOfOrigin,
    3925             :     const common::Angle &colatitudeConeAxis,
    3926             :     const common::Angle &latitudePseudoStandardParallel,
    3927             :     const common::Scale &scaleFactorPseudoStandardParallel,
    3928             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3929             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_KROVAK_NORTH_ORIENTED,
    3930           4 :                   createParams(latitudeProjectionCentre, longitudeOfOrigin,
    3931             :                                colatitudeConeAxis,
    3932             :                                latitudePseudoStandardParallel,
    3933             :                                scaleFactorPseudoStandardParallel, falseEasting,
    3934           2 :                                falseNorthing));
    3935             : }
    3936             : 
    3937             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3938             : 
    3939             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Krovak]
    3940             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/krovak.html) projection method.
    3941             :  *
    3942             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9819]
    3943             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9819)
    3944             :  *
    3945             :  * The coordinates are returned in the historical order: southing, westing
    3946             :  * This method is similar to createKrovakNorthOriented(), except that the later
    3947             :  *returns
    3948             :  * projected values as easting, northing, where
    3949             :  * easting(Krovak_North) = -westing(Krovak) and
    3950             :  * northing(Krovak_North) = -southing(Krovak).
    3951             :  *
    3952             :  * @note The current PROJ implementation of Krovak hard-codes
    3953             :  * colatitudeConeAxis = 30deg17'17.30311"
    3954             :  * and latitudePseudoStandardParallel = 78deg30'N, which are the values used for
    3955             :  * the ProjectedCRS S-JTSK (Ferro) / Krovak East North (EPSG:5221).
    3956             :  * It also hard-codes the parameters of the Bessel ellipsoid typically used for
    3957             :  * Krovak.
    3958             :  *
    3959             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3960             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3961             :  * @param latitudeProjectionCentre See \ref latitude_projection_centre
    3962             :  * @param longitudeOfOrigin See \ref longitude_of_origin
    3963             :  * @param colatitudeConeAxis See \ref colatitude_cone_axis
    3964             :  * @param latitudePseudoStandardParallel See \ref
    3965             :  *latitude_pseudo_standard_parallel
    3966             :  * @param scaleFactorPseudoStandardParallel See \ref
    3967             :  *scale_factor_pseudo_standard_parallel
    3968             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    3969             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    3970             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    3971             :  */
    3972             : ConversionNNPtr
    3973           2 : Conversion::createKrovak(const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    3974             :                          const common::Angle &latitudeProjectionCentre,
    3975             :                          const common::Angle &longitudeOfOrigin,
    3976             :                          const common::Angle &colatitudeConeAxis,
    3977             :                          const common::Angle &latitudePseudoStandardParallel,
    3978             :                          const common::Scale &scaleFactorPseudoStandardParallel,
    3979             :                          const common::Length &falseEasting,
    3980             :                          const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    3981             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_KROVAK,
    3982           4 :                   createParams(latitudeProjectionCentre, longitudeOfOrigin,
    3983             :                                colatitudeConeAxis,
    3984             :                                latitudePseudoStandardParallel,
    3985             :                                scaleFactorPseudoStandardParallel, falseEasting,
    3986           2 :                                falseNorthing));
    3987             : }
    3988             : 
    3989             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    3990             : 
    3991             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Lambert Azimuthal Equal Area]
    3992             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/laea.html) projection method.
    3993             :  *
    3994             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9820]
    3995             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9820)
    3996             :  *
    3997             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    3998             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    3999             :  * @param latitudeNatOrigin See \ref center_latitude
    4000             :  * @param longitudeNatOrigin See \ref center_longitude
    4001             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    4002             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    4003             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    4004             :  */
    4005           3 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createLambertAzimuthalEqualArea(
    4006             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &latitudeNatOrigin,
    4007             :     const common::Angle &longitudeNatOrigin, const common::Length &falseEasting,
    4008             :     const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    4009             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_AZIMUTHAL_EQUAL_AREA,
    4010           6 :                   createParams(latitudeNatOrigin, longitudeNatOrigin,
    4011           3 :                                falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    4012             : }
    4013             : 
    4014             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4015             : 
    4016             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Miller Cylindrical]
    4017             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/mill.html) projection method.
    4018             :  *
    4019             :  * There is no equivalent in EPSG.
    4020             :  *

    4022             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.

    4025             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing

    4033             : }
    4034             : 
    4035             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4036             : 
    4037             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Mercator]
    4038             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/merc.html) projection method.
    4039             :  *
    4040             :  * This is the variant, also known as Mercator (1SP), defined with the scale
    4041             :  * factor. Note that latitude of natural origin (centerLat) is a parameter,
    4042             :  * but unused in the transformation formulas.
    4043             :  *
    4044             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9804]
    4045             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9804)
    4046             :  *
    4047             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    4048             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    4049             :  * @param centerLat See \ref center_latitude . Should be 0.
    4050             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    4051             :  * @param scale See \ref scale
    4052             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    4053             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    4054             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    4055             :  */
    4056          13 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createMercatorVariantA(
    4057             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &centerLat,
    4058             :     const common::Angle &centerLong, const common::Scale &scale,
    4059             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    4060             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_MERCATOR_VARIANT_A,
    4061          26 :                   createParams(centerLat, centerLong, scale, falseEasting,
    4062          13 :                                falseNorthing));
    4063             : }
    4064             : 
    4065             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4066             : 
    4067             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Mercator]
    4068             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/merc.html) projection method.
    4069             :  *
    4070             :  * This is the variant, also known as Mercator (2SP), defined with the latitude
    4071             :  * of the first standard parallel (the second standard parallel is implicitly
    4072             :  * the opposite value). The latitude of natural origin is fixed to zero.
    4073             :  *
    4074             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9805]
    4075             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9805)
    4076             :  *
    4077             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    4078             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    4079             :  * @param latitudeFirstParallel See \ref latitude_first_std_parallel
    4080             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    4081             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    4082             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    4083             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    4084             :  */
    4085          13 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createMercatorVariantB(
    4086             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties,
    4087             :     const common::Angle &latitudeFirstParallel, const common::Angle &centerLong,
    4088             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    4089             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_MERCATOR_VARIANT_B,
    4090          26 :                   createParams(latitudeFirstParallel, centerLong, falseEasting,
    4091          13 :                                falseNorthing));
    4092             : }
    4093             : 
    4094             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4095             : 
    4096             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Popular Visualisation Pseudo
    4097             :  *Mercator]
    4098             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/webmerc.html) projection method.
    4099             :  *
    4100             :  * Also known as WebMercator. Mostly/only used for Projected CRS EPSG:3857
    4101             :  * (WGS 84 / Pseudo-Mercator)
    4102             :  *
    4103             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:1024]
    4104             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::1024)
    4105             :  *
    4106             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    4107             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    4108             :  * @param centerLat See \ref center_latitude . Usually 0
    4109             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude . Usually 0
    4110             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting . Usually 0
    4111             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing . Usually 0
    4112             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    4113             :  */

    4344             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    4345             :     return create(properties, PROJ_WKT2_NAME_METHOD_SINUSOIDAL,
    4346           4 :                   createParams(centerLong, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    4347             : }
    4348             : 
    4349             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4350             : 
    4351             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Stereographic]
    4352             :  *(https://proj.org/operations/projections/stere.html) projection method.
    4353             :  *
    4354             :  * There is no equivalent in EPSG. This method implements the original "Oblique
    4355             :  * Stereographic" method described in "Snyder's Map Projections - A Working
    4356             :  *manual",
    4357             :  * which is different from the "Oblique Stereographic (alternative") method
    4358             :  * implemented in createObliqueStereographic().
    4359             :  *
    4360             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    4361             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    4362             :  * @param centerLat See \ref center_latitude
    4363             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    4364             :  * @param scale See \ref scale
    4365             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting
    4366             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing
    4367             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    4368             :  */
    4369           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createStereographic(
    4370             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &centerLat,
    4371             :     const common::Angle &centerLong, const common::Scale &scale,
    4372             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    4373             :     return create(properties, PROJ_WKT2_NAME_METHOD_STEREOGRAPHIC,
    4374           4 :                   createParams(centerLat, centerLong, scale, falseEasting,
    4375           4 :                                falseNorthing));
    4376             : }
    4377             :

    4608             :  *

    4610             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    4611             :  * @param centerLong See \ref center_longitude
    4612             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting

    4616           2 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createEqualEarth(
    4617             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &centerLong,
    4618             :     const common::Length &falseEasting, const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    4619             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_EQUAL_EARTH,
    4620           4 :                   createParams(centerLong, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    4621             : }
    4622             : 
    4623             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4624             : 
    4625             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the [Vertical Perspective]
    4626             :  * (https://proj.org/operations/projections/nsper.html) projection method.
    4627             :  *
    4628             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9838]
    4629             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9838)
    4630             :  *
    4631             :  * The PROJ implementation of the EPSG Vertical Perspective has the current
    4632             :  * limitations with respect to the method described in EPSG:
    4633             :  * <ul>
    4634             :  * <li> it is a 2D-only method, ignoring the ellipsoidal height of the point to
    4635             :  *      project.</li>
    4636             :  * <li> it has only a spherical development.</li>
    4637             :  * <li> the height of the topocentric origin is ignored, and thus assumed to be
    4638             :  * 0.</li>
    4639             :  * </ul>
    4640             :  *
    4641             :  * For completness, PROJ adds the falseEasting and falseNorthing parameter,
    4642             :  * which are not described in EPSG. They should usually be set to 0.
    4643             :  *
    4644             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the conversion. If the name
    4645             :  * is not provided, it is automatically set.
    4646             :  * @param topoOriginLat Latitude of topocentric origin
    4647             :  * @param topoOriginLong Longitude of topocentric origin
    4648             :  * @param topoOriginHeight Ellipsoidal height of topocentric origin. Ignored by
    4649             :  * PROJ (that is assumed to be 0)
    4650             :  * @param viewPointHeight Viewpoint height with respect to the
    4651             :  * topocentric/mapping plane. In the case where topoOriginHeight = 0, this is
    4652             :  * the height above the ellipsoid surface at topoOriginLat, topoOriginLong.
    4653             :  * @param falseEasting See \ref false_easting . (not in EPSG)
    4654             :  * @param falseNorthing See \ref false_northing . (not in EPSG)
    4655             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    4656             :  *
    4657             :  * @since 7.0
    4658             :  */
    4659           3 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createVerticalPerspective(
    4660             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const common::Angle &topoOriginLat,
    4661             :     const common::Angle &topoOriginLong, const common::Length &topoOriginHeight,
    4662             :     const common::Length &viewPointHeight, const common::Length &falseEasting,
    4663             :     const common::Length &falseNorthing) {
    4664             :     return create(properties, EPSG_CODE_METHOD_VERTICAL_PERSPECTIVE,
    4665           6 :                   createParams(topoOriginLat, topoOriginLong, topoOriginHeight,
    4666           3 :                                viewPointHeight, falseEasting, falseNorthing));
    4667             : }
    4668             : 
    4669             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4670             :

    4729             : /** \brief Instantiate a conversion based on the Axis order reversal method
    4730             :  *

    4732             :  *
    4733             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9843]
    4734             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9843),
    4735             :  * or for 3D as [EPSG:9844]
    4736             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9844)
    4737             :  *
    4738             :  * @param is3D Whether this should apply on 3D geographicCRS
    4739             :  * @return a new Conversion.
    4740             :  */
    4741          81 : ConversionNNPtr Conversion::createAxisOrderReversal(bool is3D) {
    4742          81 :     if (is3D) {
    4743          10 :         return create(createMapNameEPSGCode(
    4744             :                           "axis order change (geographic3D horizontal)", 15499),
    4745          10 :                       createMethodMapNameEPSGCode(
    4746             :                           EPSG_CODE_METHOD_AXIS_ORDER_REVERSAL_3D),
    4747          10 :                       {}, {});
    4748             :     } else {
    4749         152 :         return create(createMapNameEPSGCode(AXIS_ORDER_CHANGE_2D_NAME, 15498),
    4750         152 :                       createMethodMapNameEPSGCode(
    4751             :                           EPSG_CODE_METHOD_AXIS_ORDER_REVERSAL_2D),
    4752         152 :                       {}, {});
    4753             :     }
    4754             : }
    4755             :

    4774             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4775             : 
    4776             : //! @cond Doxygen_Suppress
    4777             : 
    4778        2192 : static const char *getCRSQualifierStr(const crs::CRSPtr &crs) {
    4779        2192 :     auto geod = dynamic_cast<crs::GeodeticCRS *>(crs.get());
    4780        2192 :     if (geod) {
    4781        2117 :         if (geod->isGeocentric()) {
    4782             :             return " (geocentric)";
    4783             :         }
    4784        1826 :         auto geog = dynamic_cast<crs::GeographicCRS *>(geod);
    4785        1826 :         if (geog) {
    4786        5478 :             if (geog->coordinateSystem()->axisList().size() == 2) {
    4787             :                 return " (geog2D)";
    4788             :             } else {
    4789         257 :                 return " (geog3D)";
    4790             :             }
    4791             :         }
    4792             :     }
    4793             :     return "";
    4794             : }
    4795             : 
    4796             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    4797             : 
    4798        9501 : static std::string buildOpName(const char *opType, const crs::CRSPtr &source,
    4799             :                                const crs::CRSPtr &target) {
    4800        9501 :     std::string res(opType);
    4801        9501 :     const auto &srcName = source->nameStr();
    4802        9501 :     const auto &targetName = target->nameStr();
    4803             :     const char *srcQualifier = "";
    4804             :     const char *targetQualifier = "";

    5011        1455 : static double msfn(double phi, double e2) {

    5018             : 
    5019             : static double tsfn(double phi, double ec) {
    5020        1934 :     const double sinphi = std::sin(phi);
    5021        1934 :     return pj_tsfn(phi, sinphi, ec);
    5022             : }
    5023             : 
    5024             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    5025             : 
    5026             : // Function whose zeroes are the sin of the standard parallels of LCC_2SP
    5027          97 : static double lcc_1sp_to_2sp_f(double sinphi, double K, double ec, double n) {
    5028             :     const double x = sinphi;
    5029          97 :     const double ecx = ec * x;
    5030          97 :     return (1 - x * x) / (1 - ecx * ecx) -
    5031         194 :            K * K * std::pow((1.0 - x) / (1.0 + x) *
    5032          97 :                                 std::pow((1.0 + ecx) / (1.0 - ecx), ec),
    5033          97 :                             n);
    5034             : }
    5035             : 
    5036             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    5037             : 
    5038             : // Find the sin of the standard parallels of LCC_2SP
    5039           2 : static double find_zero_lcc_1sp_to_2sp_f(double sinphi0, bool bNorth, double K,
    5040             :                                          double ec) {
    5041             :     double a, b;
    5042             :     double f_a;
    5043           2 :     if (bNorth) {
    5044             :         // Look for zero above phi0
    5045             :         a = sinphi0;
    5046             :         b = 1.0;   // sin(North pole)
    5047             :         f_a = 1.0; // some positive value, but we only care about the sign
    5048             :     } else {
    5049             :         // Look for zero below phi0
    5050             :         a = -1.0; // sin(South pole)
    5051             :         b = sinphi0;
    5052             :         f_a = -1.0; // minus infinity in fact, but we only care about the sign
    5053             :     }
    5054             :     // We use dichotomy search. lcc_1sp_to_2sp_f() is positive at sinphi_init,
    5055             :     // has a zero in ]-1,sinphi0[ and ]sinphi0,1[ ranges
    5056         192 :     for (int N = 0; N < 100; N++) {
    5057          97 :         double c = (a + b) / 2;
    5058          97 :         double f_c = lcc_1sp_to_2sp_f(c, K, ec, sinphi0);
    5059          97 :         if (f_c == 0.0 || (b - a) < 1e-18) {
    5060             :             return c;
    5061             :         }
    5062          95 :         if ((f_c > 0 && f_a > 0) || (f_c < 0 && f_a < 0)) {
    5063             :             a = c;
    5064             :             f_a = f_c;
    5065             :         } else {
    5066             :             b = c;
    5067             :         }
    5068             :     }
    5069           0 :     return (a + b) / 2;
    5070             : }
    5071             : 
    5072           1 : static inline double DegToRad(double x) { return x / 180.0 * M_PI; }
    5073         482 : static inline double RadToDeg(double x) { return x / M_PI * 180.0; }

    5077             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    5078             : 
    5079             : /**
    5080             :  * \brief Return an equivalent projection.
    5081             :  *
    5082             :  * Currently implemented:
    5083             :  * <ul>
    5084             :  * <li>EPSG_CODE_METHOD_MERCATOR_VARIANT_A (1SP) to
    5085             :  * EPSG_CODE_METHOD_MERCATOR_VARIANT_B (2SP)</li>
    5086             :  * <li>EPSG_CODE_METHOD_MERCATOR_VARIANT_B (2SP) to
    5087             :  * EPSG_CODE_METHOD_MERCATOR_VARIANT_A (1SP)</li>
    5088             :  * <li>EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_1SP to
    5089             :  * EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_2SP</li>
    5090             :  * <li>EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_2SP to
    5091             :  * EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_1SP</li>
    5092             :  * </ul>
    5093             :  *
    5094             :  * @param targetEPSGCode EPSG code of the target method.
    5095             :  * @return new conversion, or nullptr
    5096             :  */
    5097         513 : ConversionPtr Conversion::convertToOtherMethod(int targetEPSGCode) const {
    5098        1026 :     const int current_epsg_code = method()->getEPSGCode();
    5099         513 :     if (current_epsg_code == targetEPSGCode) {
    5100           2 :         return util::nn_dynamic_pointer_cast<Conversion>(shared_from_this());
    5101             :     }
    5102             : 
    5103        1022 :     auto geogCRS = dynamic_cast<crs::GeodeticCRS *>(sourceCRS().get());
    5104         511 :     if (!geogCRS) {
    5105             :         return nullptr;
    5106             :     }
    5107             :

    5110             :         return nullptr;
    5111             :     }

    5115           8 :         parameterValueNumericAsSI(
    5116             :             EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LATITUDE_OF_NATURAL_ORIGIN) == 0.0) {
    5117             :         const double k0 = parameterValueNumericAsSI(
    5118           8 :             EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_SCALE_FACTOR_AT_NATURAL_ORIGIN);

    5160             :     }
    5161             : 
    5162         984 :     if (current_epsg_code == EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_1SP &&
    5163         492 :         targetEPSGCode == EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_2SP) {
    5164             :         // Notations m0, t0, n, m1, t1, F are those of the EPSG guidance
    5165             :         // "1.3.1.1 Lambert Conic Conformal (2SP)" and
    5166             :         // "1.3.1.2 Lambert Conic Conformal (1SP)" and
    5167             :         // or Snyder pages 106-109
    5168             :         auto latitudeOfOrigin = common::Angle(parameterValueMeasure(
    5169          12 :             EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LATITUDE_OF_NATURAL_ORIGIN));
    5170           6 :         const double phi0 = latitudeOfOrigin.getSIValue();

    5172           6 :             EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_SCALE_FACTOR_AT_NATURAL_ORIGIN);

    5174             :             return nullptr;
    5175           5 :         if (!(k0 > 0 && k0 <= 1.0 + 1e-10))
    5176             :             return nullptr;
    5177           4 :         const double ec = std::sqrt(e2);
    5178           4 :         const double m0 = msfn(phi0, e2);
    5179             :         const double t0 = tsfn(phi0, ec);
    5180             :         const double n = sin(phi0);
    5181           4 :         if (std::fabs(n) < 1e-10)
    5182             :             return nullptr;
    5183           3 :         if (fabs(k0 - 1.0) <= 1e-10) {
    5184             :             auto conv = createLambertConicConformal_2SP(
    5185           4 :                 util::PropertyMap(), latitudeOfOrigin,

    5187             :                     EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LONGITUDE_OF_NATURAL_ORIGIN)),
    5188             :                 latitudeOfOrigin, latitudeOfOrigin,
    5189           4 :                 common::Length(
    5190             :                     parameterValueMeasure(EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_FALSE_EASTING)),
    5191           4 :                 common::Length(
    5192           2 :                     parameterValueMeasure(EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_FALSE_NORTHING)));
    5193           2 :             conv->setCRSs(this, false);
    5194             :             return conv.as_nullable();
    5195             :         } else {
    5196           1 :             const double K = k0 * m0 / std::pow(t0, n);
    5197             :             const double phi1 =
    5198           1 :                 std::asin(find_zero_lcc_1sp_to_2sp_f(n, true, K, ec));
    5199             :             const double phi2 =
    5200           1 :                 std::asin(find_zero_lcc_1sp_to_2sp_f(n, false, K, ec));
    5201             :             double phi1Deg = RadToDeg(phi1);
    5202             :             double phi2Deg = RadToDeg(phi2);
    5203             : 
    5204             :             // Try to round to hundreth of degree if very close to it
    5205           1 :             if (std::fabs(phi1Deg * 1000 - std::floor(phi1Deg * 1000 + 0.5)) <
    5206             :                 1e-8)
    5207           1 :                 phi1Deg = floor(phi1Deg * 1000 + 0.5) / 1000;
    5208           1 :             if (std::fabs(phi2Deg * 1000 - std::floor(phi2Deg * 1000 + 0.5)) <
    5209             :                 1e-8)
    5210           1 :                 phi2Deg = std::floor(phi2Deg * 1000 + 0.5) / 1000;
    5211             : 
    5212             :             // The following improvement is too turn the LCC1SP equivalent of
    5213             :             // EPSG:2154 to the real LCC2SP
    5214             :             // If the computed latitude of origin is close to .0 or .5 degrees
    5215             :             // then check if rounding it to it will get a false northing
    5216             :             // close to an integer
    5217             :             const double FN =
    5218           1 :                 parameterValueNumericAsSI(EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_FALSE_NORTHING);
    5219           1 :             const double latitudeOfOriginDeg =
    5220             :                 latitudeOfOrigin.convertToUnit(common::UnitOfMeasure::DEGREE);
    5221           2 :             if (std::fabs(latitudeOfOriginDeg * 2 -
    5222           1 :                           std::floor(latitudeOfOriginDeg * 2 + 0.5)) < 0.2) {
    5223           1 :                 const double dfRoundedLatOfOrig =
    5224             :                     std::floor(latitudeOfOriginDeg * 2 + 0.5) / 2;
    5225           1 :                 const double m1 = msfn(phi1, e2);
    5226             :                 const double t1 = tsfn(phi1, ec);
    5227           1 :                 const double F = m1 / (n * std::pow(t1, n));
    5228             :                 const double a =
    5229           2 :                     geogCRS->ellipsoid()->semiMajorAxis().getSIValue();
    5230             :                 const double tRoundedLatOfOrig =
    5231             :                     tsfn(DegToRad(dfRoundedLatOfOrig), ec);
    5232             :                 const double FN_correction =
    5233           1 :                     a * F * (std::pow(tRoundedLatOfOrig, n) - std::pow(t0, n));
    5234           1 :                 const double FN_corrected = FN - FN_correction;
    5235           1 :                 const double FN_corrected_rounded =
    5236           1 :                     std::floor(FN_corrected + 0.5);
    5237           1 :                 if (std::fabs(FN_corrected - FN_corrected_rounded) < 1e-8) {
    5238             :                     auto conv = createLambertConicConformal_2SP(
    5239           2 :                         util::PropertyMap(),
    5240           2 :                         common::Angle(dfRoundedLatOfOrig,
    5241             :                                       common::UnitOfMeasure::DEGREE),
    5242           2 :                         common::Angle(parameterValueMeasure(
    5243             :                             EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LONGITUDE_OF_NATURAL_ORIGIN)),
    5244           2 :                         common::Angle(phi1Deg, common::UnitOfMeasure::DEGREE),
    5245           2 :                         common::Angle(phi2Deg, common::UnitOfMeasure::DEGREE),
    5246           2 :                         common::Length(parameterValueMeasure(
    5247             :                             EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_FALSE_EASTING)),
    5248           3 :                         common::Length(FN_corrected_rounded));
    5249           1 :                     conv->setCRSs(this, false);
    5250             :                     return conv.as_nullable();
    5251             :                 }
    5252             :             }
    5253             : 
    5254             :             auto conv = createLambertConicConformal_2SP(
    5255           0 :                 util::PropertyMap(), latitudeOfOrigin,
    5256           0 :                 common::Angle(parameterValueMeasure(
    5257             :                     EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LONGITUDE_OF_NATURAL_ORIGIN)),
    5258           0 :                 common::Angle(phi1Deg, common::UnitOfMeasure::DEGREE),
    5259           0 :                 common::Angle(phi2Deg, common::UnitOfMeasure::DEGREE),
    5260           0 :                 common::Length(
    5261             :                     parameterValueMeasure(EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_FALSE_EASTING)),
    5262           0 :                 common::Length(FN));
    5263           0 :             conv->setCRSs(this, false);
    5264             :             return conv.as_nullable();
    5265             :         }
    5266             :     }
    5267             : 
    5268         972 :     if (current_epsg_code == EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_2SP &&
    5269         486 :         targetEPSGCode == EPSG_CODE_METHOD_LAMBERT_CONIC_CONFORMAL_1SP) {
    5270             :         // Notations m0, t0, m1, t1, m2, t2 n, F are those of the EPSG guidance
    5271             :         // "1.3.1.1 Lambert Conic Conformal (2SP)" and
    5272             :         // "1.3.1.2 Lambert Conic Conformal (1SP)" and
    5273             :         // or Snyder pages 106-109
    5274             :         const double phiF =
    5275         486 :             parameterValueMeasure(EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LATITUDE_FALSE_ORIGIN)
    5276         486 :                 .getSIValue();
    5277             :         const double phi1 =
    5278         486 :             parameterValueMeasure(EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LATITUDE_1ST_STD_PARALLEL)
    5279         486 :                 .getSIValue();
    5280             :         const double phi2 =
    5281         486 :             parameterValueMeasure(EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LATITUDE_2ND_STD_PARALLEL)
    5282         486 :                 .getSIValue();
    5283         486 :         if (!(std::fabs(phiF) < M_PI / 2))
    5284             :             return nullptr;
    5285         485 :         if (!(std::fabs(phi1) < M_PI / 2))
    5286             :             return nullptr;
    5287         484 :         if (!(std::fabs(phi2) < M_PI / 2))
    5288             :             return nullptr;
    5289         483 :         const double ec = std::sqrt(e2);
    5290         483 :         const double m1 = msfn(phi1, e2);
    5291         483 :         const double m2 = msfn(phi2, e2);
    5292             :         const double t1 = tsfn(phi1, ec);
    5293             :         const double t2 = tsfn(phi2, ec);
    5294         483 :         const double n_denom = std::log(t1) - std::log(t2);
    5295         483 :         const double n = (std::fabs(n_denom) < 1e-10)
    5296         955 :                              ? std::sin(phi1)
    5297         472 :                              : (std::log(m1) - std::log(m2)) / n_denom;
    5298         483 :         if (std::fabs(n) < 1e-10)
    5299             :             return nullptr;
    5300         481 :         const double F = m1 / (n * std::pow(t1, n));
    5301         481 :         const double phi0 = std::asin(n);
    5302         481 :         const double m0 = msfn(phi0, e2);
    5303             :         const double t0 = tsfn(phi0, ec);
    5304         481 :         const double F0 = m0 / (n * std::pow(t0, n));
    5305         481 :         const double k0 = F / F0;
    5306         962 :         const double a = geogCRS->ellipsoid()->semiMajorAxis().getSIValue();
    5307             :         const double tF = tsfn(phiF, ec);
    5308             :         const double FN_correction =
    5309         481 :             a * F * (std::pow(tF, n) - std::pow(t0, n));
    5310             : 
    5311             :         double phi0Deg = RadToDeg(phi0);
    5312             :         // Try to round to thousandth of degree if very close to it
    5313         481 :         if (std::fabs(phi0Deg * 1000 - std::floor(phi0Deg * 1000 + 0.5)) < 1e-8)
    5314           3 :             phi0Deg = std::floor(phi0Deg * 1000 + 0.5) / 1000;
    5315             : 
    5316             :         auto conv = createLambertConicConformal_1SP(
    5317         962 :             util::PropertyMap(),
    5318         962 :             common::Angle(phi0Deg, common::UnitOfMeasure::DEGREE),
    5319         962 :             common::Angle(parameterValueMeasure(
    5320             :                 EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_LONGITUDE_FALSE_ORIGIN)),
    5321         962 :             common::Scale(k0), common::Length(parameterValueMeasure(
    5322             :                                    EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_EASTING_FALSE_ORIGIN)),
    5323         962 :             common::Length(
    5324         481 :                 parameterValueNumericAsSI(
    5325             :                     EPSG_CODE_PARAMETER_NORTHING_FALSE_ORIGIN) +
    5326         962 :                 (std::fabs(FN_correction) > 1e-8 ? FN_correction : 0)));
    5327         481 :         conv->setCRSs(this, false);
    5328             :         return conv.as_nullable();
    5329             :     }

    5331             :     return nullptr;

    6410             : /** \brief Return the TOWGS84 parameters of the transformation.
    6411             :  *
    6412             :  * If this transformation uses Coordinate Frame Rotation, Position Vector
    6413             :  * transformation or Geocentric translations, a vector of 7 double values
    6414             :  * using the Position Vector convention (EPSG:9606) is returned. Those values
    6415             :  * can be used as the value of the WKT1 TOWGS84 parameter or
    6416             :  * PROJ +towgs84 parameter.

    6565             : /** \brief Instantiate a transformation from a vector of GeneralParameterValue.
    6566             :  *
    6567             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties. At minimum the name should be
    6568             :  * defined.

    6572             :  * @param methodIn Operation method.
    6573             :  * @param values Vector of GeneralOperationParameterNNPtr.
    6574             :  * @param accuracies Vector of positional accuracy (might be empty).
    6575             :  * @return new Transformation.
    6576             :  * @throws InvalidOperation
    6577             :  */
    6578       27267 : TransformationNNPtr Transformation::create(
    6579             :     const util::PropertyMap &properties, const crs::CRSNNPtr &sourceCRSIn,
    6580             :     const crs::CRSNNPtr &targetCRSIn, const crs::CRSPtr &interpolationCRSIn,

    6957             : 
    6958             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    6959             : 
    6960             : /** \brief Instantiate a transformation with Time Dependent position vector
    6961             :  * transformation method.
    6962             :  *
    6963             :  * This is similar to createTimeDependentCoordinateFrameRotation(), except that
    6964             :  * the sign of
    6965             :  * the rotation terms is inverted.
    6966             :  *
    6967             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:1053]
    6968             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::1053)
    6969             :  *
    6970             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the Transformation.
    6971             :  * At minimum the name should be defined.
    6972             :  * @param sourceCRSIn Source CRS.
    6973             :  * @param targetCRSIn Target CRS.
    6974             :  * @param translationXMetre Value of the Translation_X parameter (in metre).
    6975             :  * @param translationYMetre Value of the Translation_Y parameter (in metre).
    6976             :  * @param translationZMetre Value of the Translation_Z parameter (in metre).
    6977             :  * @param rotationXArcSecond Value of the Rotation_X parameter (in
    6978             :  * arc-second).
    6979             :  * @param rotationYArcSecond Value of the Rotation_Y parameter (in
    6980             :  * arc-second).
    6981             :  * @param rotationZArcSecond Value of the Rotation_Z parameter (in
    6982             :  * arc-second).
    6983             :  * @param scaleDifferencePPM Value of the Scale_Difference parameter (in
    6984             :  * parts-per-million).
    6985             :  * @param rateTranslationX Value of the rate of change of X-axis translation (in
    6986             :  * metre/year)
    6987             :  * @param rateTranslationY Value of the rate of change of Y-axis translation (in
    6988             :  * metre/year)
    6989             :  * @param rateTranslationZ Value of the rate of change of Z-axis translation (in
    6990             :  * metre/year)
    6991             :  * @param rateRotationX Value of the rate of change of X-axis rotation (in
    6992             :  * arc-second/year)
    6993             :  * @param rateRotationY Value of the rate of change of Y-axis rotation (in
    6994             :  * arc-second/year)
    6995             :  * @param rateRotationZ Value of the rate of change of Z-axis rotation (in
    6996             :  * arc-second/year)
    6997             :  * @param rateScaleDifference Value of the rate of change of scale difference
    6998             :  * (in PPM/year)
    6999             :  * @param referenceEpochYear Parameter reference epoch (in decimal year)
    7000             :  * @param accuracies Vector of positional accuracy (might be empty).
    7001             :  * @return new Transformation.
    7002             :  */
