    7034             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    7035             : 
    7036             : /** \brief Instantiate a transformation with Time Dependent Position coordinate
    7037             :  * frame rotation transformation method.
    7038             :  *
    7039             :  * This is similar to createTimeDependentPositionVector(), except that the sign
    7040             :  * of
    7041             :  * the rotation terms is inverted.
    7042             :  *
    7043             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:1056]
    7044             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::1056)
    7045             :  *
    7046             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the Transformation.
    7047             :  * At minimum the name should be defined.
    7048             :  * @param sourceCRSIn Source CRS.
    7049             :  * @param targetCRSIn Target CRS.
    7050             :  * @param translationXMetre Value of the Translation_X parameter (in metre).
    7051             :  * @param translationYMetre Value of the Translation_Y parameter (in metre).
    7052             :  * @param translationZMetre Value of the Translation_Z parameter (in metre).
    7053             :  * @param rotationXArcSecond Value of the Rotation_X parameter (in
    7054             :  * arc-second).
    7055             :  * @param rotationYArcSecond Value of the Rotation_Y parameter (in
    7056             :  * arc-second).
    7057             :  * @param rotationZArcSecond Value of the Rotation_Z parameter (in
    7058             :  * arc-second).
    7059             :  * @param scaleDifferencePPM Value of the Scale_Difference parameter (in
    7060             :  * parts-per-million).
    7061             :  * @param rateTranslationX Value of the rate of change of X-axis translation (in
    7062             :  * metre/year)
    7063             :  * @param rateTranslationY Value of the rate of change of Y-axis translation (in
    7064             :  * metre/year)
    7065             :  * @param rateTranslationZ Value of the rate of change of Z-axis translation (in
    7066             :  * metre/year)
    7067             :  * @param rateRotationX Value of the rate of change of X-axis rotation (in
    7068             :  * arc-second/year)
    7069             :  * @param rateRotationY Value of the rate of change of Y-axis rotation (in
    7070             :  * arc-second/year)
    7071             :  * @param rateRotationZ Value of the rate of change of Z-axis rotation (in
    7072             :  * arc-second/year)
    7073             :  * @param rateScaleDifference Value of the rate of change of scale difference
    7074             :  * (in PPM/year)
    7075             :  * @param referenceEpochYear Parameter reference epoch (in decimal year)
    7076             :  * @param accuracies Vector of positional accuracy (might be empty).
    7077             :  * @return new Transformation.
    7078             :  * @throws InvalidOperation
    7079             :  */
    7080           1 : TransformationNNPtr Transformation::createTimeDependentCoordinateFrameRotation(

    7146             : /** \brief Instantiate a transformation with Molodensky method.
    7147             :  *
    7148             :  * @see createAbridgedMolodensky() for a related method.
    7149             :  *
    7150             :  * This method is defined as [EPSG:9604]
    7151             :  * (https://www.epsg-registry.org/export.htm?gml=urn:ogc:def:method:EPSG::9604)
    7152             :  *
    7153             :  * @param properties See \ref general_properties of the Transformation.
    7154             :  * At minimum the name should be defined.
    7155             :  * @param sourceCRSIn Source CRS.
    7156             :  * @param targetCRSIn Target CRS.
    7157             :  * @param translationXMetre Value of the Translation_X parameter (in metre).
    7158             :  * @param translationYMetre Value of the Translation_Y parameter (in metre).
    7159             :  * @param translationZMetre Value of the Translation_Z parameter (in metre).
    7160             :  * @param semiMajorAxisDifferenceMetre The difference between the semi-major
    7161             :  * axis values of the ellipsoids used in the target and source CRS (in metre).
    7162             :  * @param flattingDifference The difference  between the flattening values of
    7163             :  * the ellipsoids used in the target and source CRS.
    7164             :  * @param accuracies Vector of positional accuracy (might be empty).
    7165             :  * @return new Transformation.
    7166             :  * @throws InvalidOperation
    7167             :  */
    7168           2 : TransformationNNPtr Transformation::createMolodensky(

    7672             : static CoordinateOperationPtr
    7673           7 : createApproximateInverseIfPossible(const Transformation *op) {
    7674             :     bool sevenParamsTransform = false;
    7675             :     bool fifteenParamsTransform = false;
    7676           7 :     const auto &method = op->method();
    7677           7 :     const auto &methodName = method->nameStr();
    7678           7 :     const int methodEPSGCode = method->getEPSGCode();
    7679           7 :     const auto paramCount = op->parameterValues().size();
    7680             :     const bool isPositionVector =
    7681           7 :         ci_find(methodName, "Position Vector") != std::string::npos;
    7682             :     const bool isCoordinateFrame =
    7683           7 :         ci_find(methodName, "Coordinate Frame") != std::string::npos;
    7684             : 
    7685             :     // See end of "2.4.3.3 Helmert 7-parameter transformations"
    7686             :     // in EPSG 7-2 guidance
    7687             :     // For practical purposes, the inverse of 7- or 15-parameters Helmert
    7688             :     // can be obtained by using the forward method with all parameters
    7689             :     // negated
    7690             :     // (except reference epoch!)
    7691             :     // So for WKT export use that. But for PROJ string, we use the +inv flag
    7692             :     // so as to get "perfect" round-tripability.
    7693           8 :     if ((paramCount == 7 && isCoordinateFrame &&
    7694           1 :          !isTimeDependent(methodName)) ||
    7695          12 :         methodEPSGCode == EPSG_CODE_METHOD_COORDINATE_FRAME_GEOCENTRIC ||

    7700           7 :         (paramCount == 15 && isCoordinateFrame &&

    7825             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    7826             : 
    7827        6570 : TransformationNNPtr Transformation::inverseAsTransformation() const {
    7828             : 
    7829        6570 :     if (d->forwardOperation_) {
    7830             :         return NN_NO_CHECK(d->forwardOperation_);
    7831             :     }
    7832        5310 :     const auto &l_method = method();
    7833        5310 :     const auto &methodName = l_method->nameStr();
    7834        5310 :     const int methodEPSGCode = l_method->getEPSGCode();
    7835        5310 :     const auto &l_sourceCRS = sourceCRS();
    7836        5310 :     const auto &l_targetCRS = targetCRS();
    7837             : 
    7838             :     // For geocentric translation, the inverse is exactly the negation of
    7839             :     // the parameters.
    7840        5310 :     if (ci_find(methodName, "Geocentric translations") != std::string::npos ||
    7841        7672 :         methodEPSGCode == EPSG_CODE_METHOD_GEOCENTRIC_TRANSLATION_GEOCENTRIC ||
    7842        3836 :         methodEPSGCode ==
    7843        9146 :             EPSG_CODE_METHOD_GEOCENTRIC_TRANSLATION_GEOGRAPHIC_2D ||
    7844             :         methodEPSGCode ==

    8764      100073 : void Transformation::_exportToPROJString(
    8765             :     io::PROJStringFormatter *formatter) const // throw(FormattingException)
    8766             : {
    8767      100073 :     if (formatter->convention() ==
    8768             :         io::PROJStringFormatter::Convention::PROJ_4) {

    8770           0 :             "Transformation cannot be exported as a PROJ.4 string");
    8771             :     }
    8772             : 
    8773      100073 :     formatter->setCoordinateOperationOptimizations(true);
    8774             : 
    8775             :     bool positionVectorConvention = true;

    8778             :     bool fifteenParamsTransform = false;
    8779      100073 :     const auto &l_method = method();

    9672             : 
    9673        3043 : void ConcatenatedOperation::fixStepsDirection(
    9674             :     const crs::CRSNNPtr &concatOpSourceCRS,
    9675             :     const crs::CRSNNPtr &concatOpTargetCRS,
    9676             :     std::vector<CoordinateOperationNNPtr> &operationsInOut) {
    9677             : 
    9678             :     // Set of heuristics to assign CRS to steps, and possibly reverse them.
    9679             : 
    9680       24485 :     for (size_t i = 0; i < operationsInOut.size(); ++i) {
    9681             :         auto &op = operationsInOut[i];
    9682        6133 :         auto l_sourceCRS = op->sourceCRS();
    9683        6133 :         auto l_targetCRS = op->targetCRS();
    9684        6133 :         auto conv = dynamic_cast<const Conversion *>(op.get());
    9685        6133 :         if (conv && i == 0 && !l_sourceCRS && !l_targetCRS) {
    9686             :             auto derivedCRS =
    9687           8 :                 dynamic_cast<const crs::DerivedCRS *>(concatOpSourceCRS.get());
    9688           4 :             if (derivedCRS) {
    9689           8 :                 if (i + 1 < operationsInOut.size()) {
    9690             :                     // use the sourceCRS of the next operation as our target CRS
    9691           8 :                     l_targetCRS = operationsInOut[i + 1]->sourceCRS();
    9692             :                     // except if it looks like the next operation should
    9693             :                     // actually be reversed !!!
    9694           7 :                     if (l_targetCRS &&
    9695           3 :                         !compareStepCRS(l_targetCRS.get(),
    9696           8 :                                         derivedCRS->baseCRS().get()) &&

   10187             : /** \brief Set how source and target CRS extent should be used
   10188             :  * when considering if a transformation can be used (only takes effect if
   10189             :  * no area of interest is explicitly defined).
   10190             :  *

   10318             : /** \brief Set whether an intermediate pivot CRS can be used for researching
   10319             :  * coordinate operations between a source and target CRS.
   10320             :  *
   10321             :  * Concretely if in the database there is an operation from A to C
   10322             :  * (or C to A), and another one from C to B (or B to C), but no direct
   10323             :  * operation between A and B, setting this parameter to
   10324             :  * ALWAYS/IF_NO_DIRECT_TRANSFORMATION, allow chaining both operations.
   10325             :  *
   10326             :  * The current implementation is limited to researching one intermediate
   10327             :  * step.
   10328             :  *
   10329             :  * By default, with the IF_NO_DIRECT_TRANSFORMATION stratgey, all potential
   10330             :  * C candidates will be used if there is no direct tranformation.
   10331             :  */

   10345             :  * ALWAYS/IF_NO_DIRECT_TRANSFORMATION, allow chaining both operations.

   10379             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   10380             : 
   10381             : /** \brief Creates a context for a coordinate operation.
   10382             :  *
   10383             :  * If a non null authorityFactory is provided, the resulting context should
   10384             :  * not be used simultaneously by more than one thread.
   10385             :  *
   10386             :  * If authorityFactory->getAuthority() is the empty string, then coordinate
   10387             :  * operations from any authority will be searched, with the restrictions set
   10388             :  * in the authority_to_authority_preference database table.
   10389             :  * If authorityFactory->getAuthority() is set to "any", then coordinate
   10390             :  * operations from any authority will be searched
   10391             :  * If authorityFactory->getAuthority() is a non-empty string different of "any",
   10392             :  * then coordinate operatiosn will be searched only in that authority namespace.
   10393             :  *
   10394             :  * @param authorityFactory Authority factory, or null if no database lookup
   10395             :  * is allowed.
   10396             :  * Use io::authorityFactory::create(context, std::string()) to allow all
   10397             :  * authorities to be used.
   10398             :  * @param extent Area of interest, or null if none is known.
   10399             :  * @param accuracy Maximum allowed accuracy in metre, as specified in or
   10400             :  * 0 to get best accuracy.
   10401             :  * @return a new context.
   10402             :  */
   10403         376 : CoordinateOperationContextNNPtr CoordinateOperationContext::create(
   10404             :     const io::AuthorityFactoryPtr &authorityFactory,
   10405             :     const metadata::ExtentPtr &extent, double accuracy) {
   10406         752 :     auto ctxt = NN_NO_CHECK(
   10407             :         CoordinateOperationContext::make_unique<CoordinateOperationContext>());
   10408             :     ctxt->d->authorityFactory_ = authorityFactory;
   10409             :     ctxt->d->extent_ = extent;
   10410         376 :     ctxt->d->accuracy_ = accuracy;
   10411         376 :     return ctxt;
   10412             : }

   10608             : /** \brief Find a CoordinateOperation from sourceCRS to targetCRS.
   10609             :  *
   10610             :  * This is a helper of createOperations(), using a coordinate operation
   10611             :  * context
   10612             :  * with no authority factory (so no catalog searching is done), no desired
   10613             :  * accuracy and no area of interest.
   10614             :  * This returns the first operation of the result set of createOperations(),
   10615             :  * or null if none found.
   10616             :  *
   10617             :  * @param sourceCRS source CRS.
   10618             :  * @param targetCRS source CRS.
   10619             :  * @return a CoordinateOperation or nullptr.
   10620             :  */
   10621         117 : CoordinateOperationPtr CoordinateOperationFactory::createOperation(
   10622             :     const crs::CRSNNPtr &sourceCRS, const crs::CRSNNPtr &targetCRS) const {
   10623             :     auto res = createOperations(
   10624             :         sourceCRS, targetCRS,
   10625         585 :         CoordinateOperationContext::create(nullptr, nullptr, 0.0));
   10626         117 :     if (!res.empty()) {
   10627             :         return res[0];
   10628             :     }
   10629             :     return nullptr;
   10630             : }
   10631             : 
   10632             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   10633             :

   10635             : 
   10636             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   10637             : 
   10638             : struct PrecomputedOpCharacteristics {
   10639             :     double area_{};
   10640             :     double accuracy_{};
   10641             :     bool isPROJExportable_ = false;
   10642             :     bool hasGrids_ = false;
   10643             :     bool gridsAvailable_ = false;
   10644             :     bool gridsKnown_ = false;
   10645             :     size_t stepCount_ = 0;
   10646             :     bool isApprox_ = false;
   10647             :     bool isNullTransformation_ = false;
   10648             : 
   10649        5432 :     PrecomputedOpCharacteristics() = default;
   10650             :     PrecomputedOpCharacteristics(double area, double accuracy,
   10651             :                                  bool isPROJExportable, bool hasGrids,
   10652             :                                  bool gridsAvailable, bool gridsKnown,
   10653             :                                  size_t stepCount, bool isApprox,
   10654             :                                  bool isNullTransformation)
   10655             :         : area_(area), accuracy_(accuracy), isPROJExportable_(isPROJExportable),
   10656             :           hasGrids_(hasGrids), gridsAvailable_(gridsAvailable),
   10657             :           gridsKnown_(gridsKnown), stepCount_(stepCount), isApprox_(isApprox),
   10658        5432 :           isNullTransformation_(isNullTransformation) {}
   10659             : };
   10660             : 
   10661             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   10662             : 
   10663             : // We could have used a lambda instead of this old-school way, but
   10664             : // filterAndSort() is already huge.
   10665             : struct SortFunction {
   10666             : 
   10667             :     const std::map<CoordinateOperation *, PrecomputedOpCharacteristics> &map;
   10668             : 
   10669             :     explicit SortFunction(const std::map<CoordinateOperation *,
   10670             :                                          PrecomputedOpCharacteristics> &mapIn)
   10671             :         : map(mapIn) {}
   10672             : 
   10673             :     // Sorting function
   10674             :     // Return true if a < b
   10675       53703 :     bool operator()(const CoordinateOperationNNPtr &a,
   10676             :                     const CoordinateOperationNNPtr &b) const {
   10677       53703 :         auto iterA = map.find(a.get());

   10680             :         assert(iterB != map.end());

   10682             :         // CAUTION: the order of the comparisons is extremely important
   10683             :         // to get the intended result.
   10684             : 
   10685      107386 :         if (iterA->second.isPROJExportable_ &&
   10686       53683 :             !iterB->second.isPROJExportable_) {
   10687             :             return true;

   11111         810 :     void removeSyntheticNullTransforms() {
   11112             : 
   11113             :         // If we have more than one result, and than the last result is the
   11114             :         // default "Ballpark geographic offset" or "Ballpark geocentric
   11115             :         // translation"

   11136         404 :     void removeUninterestingOps() {
   11137             : 
   11138             :         // Eliminate operations that bring nothing, ie for a given area of use,
   11139             :         // do not keep operations that have greater accuracy. Actually we must
   11140             :         // be a bit more subtle than that, and take into account grid
   11141             :         // availability
   11142         404 :         std::vector<CoordinateOperationNNPtr> resTemp;

   11154        5362 :             bool dummy = false;

   11176             : 
   11177             :                 lastHasGrids = curHasGrids;
   11178             :                 lastGridsAvailable = curGridsAvailable;
   11179             :                 first = false;
   11180             :             } else {
   11181        9920 :                 if (lastOp->_isEquivalentTo(op.get())) {
   11182          23 :                     continue;
   11183             :                 }
   11184             :                 const bool sameExtent =
   11185        4937 :                     ((!curExtent && !lastExtent) ||
   11186        9874 :                      (curExtent && lastExtent &&
   11187       17702 :                       curExtent->contains(NN_NO_CHECK(lastExtent)) &&
   11188       12765 :                       lastExtent->contains(NN_NO_CHECK(curExtent))));
   11189        4937 :                 if (((curAccuracy > lastAccuracy && lastAccuracy >= 0) ||
   11190        1297 :                      (curAccuracy < 0 && lastAccuracy >= 0)) &&
   11191             :                     sameExtent) {
   11192             :                     // If that set of grids has always been used for that
   11193             :                     // extent,
   11194             :                     // no need to add them again
   11195         956 :                     if (setOfSetOfGrids.find(curSetOfGrids) !=
   11196             :                         setOfSetOfGrids.end()) {
   11197         811 :                         continue;
   11198             :                     }

   11200             :                     // that extent, no need to add any lower accuracy operation
   11201         145 :                     if (!lastHasGrids) {
   11202          24 :                         continue;
   11203             :                     }

   11205             :                     // past operation had available grids, no need to add

   11214             :                     }

   11245             :     // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
   11246             : 
   11247             :     // cppcheck-suppress functionStatic
   11248         405 :     void removeDuplicateOps() {
   11249             : 
   11250         810 :         if (res.size() <= 1) {
   11251         322 :             return;
   11252             :         }
   11253             : 
   11254             :         // When going from EPSG:4807 (NTF Paris) to EPSG:4171 (RGC93), we get
   11255             :         // EPSG:7811, NTF (Paris) to RGF93 (2), 1 m
   11256             :         // and unknown id, NTF (Paris) to NTF (1) + Inverse of RGF93 to NTF (2),
   11257             :         // 1 m
   11258             :         // both have same PROJ string and extent
   11259             :         // Do not keep the later (that has more steps) as it adds no value.
   11260             : 
   11261             :         std::set<std::string> setPROJPlusExtent;
   11262          83 :         std::vector<CoordinateOperationNNPtr> resTemp;
   11263        4267 :         for (const auto &op : res) {
   11264        8368 :             auto formatter = io::PROJStringFormatter::create();

   11266        8368 :                 std::string key(op->exportToPROJString(formatter.get()));

   11304             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   11305             : 
   11306             : /** \brief Filter operations and sort them given context.
   11307             :  *
   11308             :  * If a desired accuracy is specified, only keep operations whose accuracy
   11309             :  * is at least the desired one.
   11310             :  * If an area of interest is specified, only keep operations whose area of
   11311             :  * use include the area of interest.
   11312             :  * Then sort remaining operations by descending area of use, and increasing
   11313             :  * accuracy.
   11314             :  */

   11639             : static TransformationNNPtr
   11640        1272 : createBallparkGeographicOffset(const crs::CRSNNPtr &sourceCRS,

   11642             :

   13833             : static crs::GeographicCRSPtr
   13834         225 : getInterpolationGeogCRS(const CoordinateOperationNNPtr &verticalTransform,
   13835             :                         const io::DatabaseContextPtr &dbContext) {

   13845             :             // transformation ?

   14316             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   14317             : 
   14318             : static crs::CRSNNPtr
   14319         868 : getResolvedCRS(const crs::CRSNNPtr &crs,
   14320             :                const CoordinateOperationContextNNPtr &context,
   14321             :                metadata::ExtentPtr &extentOut) {
   14322         868 :     const auto &authFactory = context->getAuthorityFactory();
   14323         868 :     const auto &ids = crs->identifiers();
   14324         868 :     const auto &name = crs->nameStr();
   14325             : 
   14326             :     bool approxExtent;
   14327        1736 :     extentOut = getExtentPossiblySynthetized(crs, approxExtent);
   14328             : 
   14329             :     // We try to "identify" the provided CRS with the ones of the database,
   14330             :     // but in a more restricted way that what identify() does.
   14331             :     // If we get a match from id in priority, and from name as a fallback, and
   14332             :     // that they are equivalent to the input CRS, then use the identified CRS.
   14333             :     // Even if they aren't equivalent, we update extentOut with the one of the
   14334             :     // identified CRS if our input one is absent/not reliable.
   14335             : 
   14336             :     const auto tryToIdentifyByName = [&crs, &name, &authFactory, approxExtent,
   14337             :                                       &extentOut](
   14338         745 :         io::AuthorityFactory::ObjectType objectType) {
   14339         314 :         if (name != "unknown" && name != "unnamed") {
   14340             :             auto matches = authFactory->createObjectsFromName(
   14341         153 :                 name, {objectType}, false, 2);
   14342          51 :             if (matches.size() == 1) {
   14343             :                 const auto match =
   14344          30 :                     util::nn_static_pointer_cast<crs::CRS>(matches.front());
   14345          49 :                 if (approxExtent || !extentOut) {
   14346          23 :                     extentOut = getExtent(match);
   14347             :                 }
   14348          60 :                 if (match->isEquivalentTo(
   14349             :                         crs.get(), util::IComparable::Criterion::EQUIVALENT)) {
   14350             :                     return match;
   14351             :                 }
   14352             :             }
   14353             :         }
   14354             :         return crs;
   14355         868 :     };
   14356             : 
   14357         868 :     auto geogCRS = dynamic_cast<crs::GeographicCRS *>(crs.get());
   14358         868 :     if (geogCRS && authFactory) {
   14359         391 :         if (!ids.empty()) {
   14360             :             const auto tmpAuthFactory = io::AuthorityFactory::create(
   14361         532 :                 authFactory->databaseContext(), *ids.front()->codeSpace());
   14362             :             try {
   14363             :                 auto resolvedCrs(
   14364         266 :                     tmpAuthFactory->createGeographicCRS(ids.front()->code()));
   14365         266 :                 if (approxExtent || !extentOut) {
   14366          64 :                     extentOut = getExtent(resolvedCrs);
   14367             :                 }
   14368         532 :                 if (resolvedCrs->isEquivalentTo(
   14369             :                         crs.get(), util::IComparable::Criterion::EQUIVALENT)) {
   14370         266 :                     return util::nn_static_pointer_cast<crs::CRS>(resolvedCrs);
   14371             :                 }
   14372           0 :             } catch (const std::exception &) {
   14373             :             }
   14374             :         } else {
   14375             :             return tryToIdentifyByName(
   14376         250 :                 geogCRS->coordinateSystem()->axisList().size() == 2
   14377             :                     ? io::AuthorityFactory::ObjectType::GEOGRAPHIC_2D_CRS
   14378         125 :                     : io::AuthorityFactory::ObjectType::GEOGRAPHIC_3D_CRS);
   14379             :         }
   14380             :     }
   14381             : 
   14382         477 :     auto projectedCrs = dynamic_cast<crs::ProjectedCRS *>(crs.get());
   14383         477 :     if (projectedCrs && authFactory) {
   14384         132 :         if (!ids.empty()) {
   14385             :             const auto tmpAuthFactory = io::AuthorityFactory::create(
   14386         100 :                 authFactory->databaseContext(), *ids.front()->codeSpace());
   14387             :             try {
   14388             :                 auto resolvedCrs(
   14389          50 :                     tmpAuthFactory->createProjectedCRS(ids.front()->code()));

   14391           2 :                     extentOut = getExtent(resolvedCrs);

   14458             : 
   14459             : // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   14460             : 
   14461             : /** \brief Find a list of CoordinateOperation from sourceCRS to targetCRS.
   14462             :  *
   14463             :  * The operations are sorted with the most relevant ones first: by
   14464             :  * descending
   14465             :  * area (intersection of the transformation area with the area of interest,
   14466             :  * or intersection of the transformation with the area of use of the CRS),
   14467             :  * and
   14468             :  * by increasing accuracy. Operations with unknown accuracy are sorted last,
   14469             :  * whatever their area.
   14470             :  *
   14471             :  * When one of the source or target CRS has a vertical component but not the
   14472             :  * other one, the one that has no vertical component is automatically promoted
   14473             :  * to a 3D version, where its vertical axis is the ellipsoidal height in metres,
   14474             :  * using the ellipsoid of the base geodetic CRS.
   14475             :  *
   14476             :  * @param sourceCRS source CRS.
   14477             :  * @param targetCRS target CRS.
   14478             :  * @param context Search context.
   14479             :  * @return a list
   14480             :  */
   14481             : std::vector<CoordinateOperationNNPtr>
   14482         406 : CoordinateOperationFactory::createOperations(
   14483             :     const crs::CRSNNPtr &sourceCRS, const crs::CRSNNPtr &targetCRS,

   14485             :

   14487             :     ENTER_FUNCTION();
   14488             : #endif
